snippet: President Obama will use the current Congressional recess to appoint Richard Cordray to lead the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a sharp challenge to Republican lawmakers who have fiercely fought the nomination, a senior administration official...
abstract: President Obama will use the current Congressional recess to appoint Richard Cordray to lead the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, a sharp challenge to Republican lawmakers who have fiercely fought the nomination, a senior administration official told The New York Times.

headline.main: Challenging Republicans, Obama to Appoint Cordray as Consumer Chief
